## ğŸ“ Exact Specifications

### Background
- **Type**: Linear gradient (diagonal or vertical)
- **Color 1** (top-left): #0EA5E9 (bright blue)
- **Color 2** (bottom-right): #0891B2 (teal)
- **Style**: Smooth, modern

### Mexican Flag Accent (Right Side)
- **Position**: Right edge, vertical stripe
- **Width**: 80-100px
- **Three colors** (top to bottom):
  - Green: #006847 (33% height)
  - White: #FFFFFF (33% height)
  - Red: #CE1126 (33% height)
- **Style**: Clean, solid colors OR slight gradient

### Calculator Icon (Center-Left)
- **Position**: Slightly left of center
- **Size**: 400-500px height
- **Color**: White #FFFFFF
- **Style**: Modern, rounded corners
- **Elements**:
  - 3x4 button grid
  - Numbers: 7,8,9,4,5,6,1,2,3,0,.,**%**
  - Make "%" button slightly emphasized

### Additional Elements
- **Small "ISR" badge** (optional):
  - Position: Bottom left or bottom center
  - Size: 120x40px
  - Background: White with 20% opacity
  - Text: "ISR" in bold, dark blue

- **OR Small peso symbol "$"**:
  - Top-left corner
  - Size: 60px
  - White color
  - 70% opacity

**This version uses:**
- Horizontal Mexican flag at top (thin stripes)
- Large calculator centered
- "ISR" or "%" text at bottom
- Clean background gradient

## ğŸ› ï¸ CANVA Tutorial - Step by Step

### Method 1: Vertical Flag Stripe

1. **Create Canvas**
   - Canva.com â†’ Custom size: 1024 x 1024

2. **Add Gradient Background**
   - Elements â†’ Shapes â†’ Square (fill canvas)
   - Color â†’ Gradients
   - Choose diagonal gradient
   - Top-left color: #0EA5E9
   - Bottom-right color: #0891B2

3. **Add Mexican Flag Stripe (Right Side)**
   - Elements â†’ Shapes â†’ Rectangle
   - Dimensions: 100px wide Ã— 1024px tall
   - Position: Align to right edge
   - Duplicate 3 times to create 3 sections:
     - Top section (340px): Green #006847
     - Middle section (340px): White #FFFFFF
     - Bottom section (344px): Red #CE1126
   - OR use lines:
     - Elements â†’ Lines â†’ Straight line
     - Make thick (100px)
     - Color appropriately

4. **Add Calculator Icon**
   - Elements â†’ Search "calculator icon white"
   - Choose modern, clean design
   - Size: 450px height
   - Position: Center-left (x: 400, y: 512)
   - Color: White
   - Make sure it has a "%" button visible

5. **Add "%" Symbol** (if calculator doesn't show it clearly)
   - Text â†’ Add heading
   - Type: "%"
   - Font: SF Pro Rounded Bold or Montserrat Black
   - Size: 120pt
   - Color: White
   - Position: Lower right of calculator

6. **Add "ISR" Badge** (Optional)
   - Elements â†’ Shapes â†’ Rounded rectangle
   - Size: 140px wide Ã— 50px tall
   - Color: White with 30% opacity
   - Position: Bottom center
   - Add text "ISR":
     - Font: Bold, 32pt
     - Color: Dark blue #1E3A8A or white
     - Center in badge

7. **Fine Tune**
   - Adjust spacing
   - Ensure calculator doesn't overlap flag stripe
   - Make sure "%" is visible
   - All elements aligned nicely

8. **Download**
   - Share â†’ Download
   - PNG, High quality
   - 1024x1024

### Method 2: Horizontal Flag Stripes (Simpler)

1. **Create Canvas**: 1024 x 1024

2. **Background**: Blue-teal gradient (#0EA5E9 to #0891B2)

3. **Mexican Flag Stripes** (Top):
   - Elements â†’ Lines â†’ Straight line
   - Make 3 horizontal lines at top:
     - Line 1: Green #006847, 30px thick, y: 30
     - Line 2: White #FFFFFF, 30px thick, y: 60
     - Line 3: Red #CE1126, 30px thick, y: 90
   - OR create 3 thin rectangles

4. **Calculator Icon**:
   - Elements â†’ Search "calculator"
   - White, 500px, centered
   - Below the flag stripes

5. **"ISR" Text** (Bottom):
   - Text â†’ "ISR"
   - Bold, 48pt, white
   - Bottom center

6. **Download**: PNG, 1024x1024

## ğŸ¯ Final Color Palette

```css
/* Background Gradient */
background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0EA5E9, #0891B2);

/* Mexican Flag Colors */
--flag-green: #006847;
--flag-white: #FFFFFF;
--flag-red: #CE1126;

/* Main Elements */
--calculator-color: #FFFFFF;
--text-color: #FFFFFF;
--badge-background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.3);
```

## ğŸš€ Quick Decision

Choose your preference:

**Layout A: Vertical Flag Stripe (Right Side)**
- Modern and dynamic
- Flag as accent
- Calculator is main focus
- More sophisticated

**Layout B: Horizontal Flag Stripes (Top)**
- Simpler and cleaner
- Traditional flag representation
- Calculator centered
- Easier to create

**I recommend Layout B** (horizontal) - it's cleaner and easier!
